title: Whenever I play Pantheon, I just feel like I soak up all the kills then do absolutely nothing.
body:
After 20 minutes in, I always feel as if I just become absolutely useless. Renekton has a ton of early power to help get early objectives, but even his lategame is better that pantheon's.  Most other lane bullies have things they can fall back on, and some champions are lane bullies AND late game monsters. Gnar, Rumble, and Darius can all be very powerful lane bullies while being very strong lategame as well, Urgot has a ton of utility, teemo gives great map control, even shaco can split push and backdoor.

But pantheon just falls off a cliff and does absolutely nothing. Can we rework him yet? Because it makes him feel horrible and unsatisfying to play.

As sololaner however, he falls a bit short later on, if he goes tanky he doesn't provid enough damage or utillity for a sololane, and if built glasscannon, it's far to easy to focus him down in fights.

As a jungle Pantheon main, yes, Panth does fall off a cliff late game.  There are ways you can make yourself useful late game though, such as focusing your attention solely on the carries, and ulting to cut off the escape routes of your enemies.

The issue here is that guys like Renekton, Volibear, and Xin Zhao can splitpush late game, and Pantheon is only slightly better at taking towers than Mages are (hell, Ziggs does a better job at it).

Pantheon is far more team reliant on his successes late game than those three.  If your team derps, those three can just split push.  If your team derps when you're playing Pantheon, you're SOL.

Pantheon got indirectly screwed preseason with the lazer towers, but everyone was paying too much attention to his ability to block dragon shots to care, and after the dust cleared he was unplayable until Warrior got buffed and Black Cleaver got reworked.

Right now, some good ideas would be to normalize his ultimate's mana cost to 100 mana, and give him some more late game utility, like a slightly longer stun on his W from 1 sec at all ranks to 1.1-1.5.  I don't know any other ideas right now that wouldn't push his early game over the edge.

Edit: Pantheon doesn't need a rework.  He's an extremely well made champion that has a low skill floor but a high skill ceiling.  He just needs some balance tweaks and some fresh ideas to reinvigorate him, and he'll be back to his good ol ass kicking top lane self.

Edit 2:  Did I mention he counters Fiora?  Because he counters Fiora.
Personally I'd love for his passive to block special empowered AA. I hate blocking Garen's Q and being silenced still. Or blocking Mordekaiser's third Q and taking all the magic damage.

That's the issue with the Mantheon.  He actually blocks Fiora's vital strikes, but Garen's silence squeaks through, and I'm pretty sure Doge's bonus damage goes through as well.

It needs consistency, same goes for Jax's dodge.

Pantheon is an extreme textbook example of a lane bully with his power curve. I main him top and use him as my go to jungler.  

In lane I roam after I take down the tower, acting as a secondary ganker. In jungle I do my basic jungle thing until teamfights start. 

Teamfights: Pantheon should never go in head on. He's the most useful from behind, especially when using your ult in their escape route. 

I also end up buying items to help take down threats. When I see armor on the enemy, I start building last whisper. 

Early game I play Pantheon like a bruiser who transitions into an assassin mid to late. Find a target, lock them down and focus them. Sadly due to his lack of escape he makes a poor assassin half the time. Played well and you won't care because you'll hopefully be playing smart enough to notice which situations are good and which aren't. 

Personally I think his kit could use a little rework. Even if they made his E active like Darius's Q in that it's not a channel.

Hey man, Pantheon main here, got to Diamond with him.

I feel he's a lot better in the top lane than the jungle. You get a better power curve in lane and can exert dominance from top. 

Typical builds I do are Ravenous Hydra, Black Cleaver, Ghostblade (situational), Randuins, Banshees/Spirit Visage/Guardian Angel

When it comes to the late game with Pantheon, your main goal is to zone backline carries and panicking the enemy team with your ult indicator. Sometimes you want to engage with your ult, pinching the enemy team with the indicator and your team's engage tools, or you'll want the fight to start and ult in about 2 seconds into the fight to disrupt the flow of things. Hydra and Black Cleaver are enough to pressure mages and marksmen, given that you actually land your Heartseeker on them and use Randuin's active to keep them in range. You probably won't get kills but you create a shitton of pressure. 

Apart from fights, split pushing is your main thing, which is why you build Ravenous Hydra. The ideal situation is that you force 1 or 2 enemies to come and stop you, and you ult to where the rest of the enemy team and your team are at and win the fight based on number advantage. Teleport helps you keep all 3 lanes in control throughout the game.
